comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Google Maps gives 425 Kent Street as near the SW corner of Kent and Market Streets, nowhere near The Rocks or Millers Point. maps.google.com/maps?q=425+Kent+St,+Sydney+NSW,+Australia... Hmmm?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: CADBURY BROTHERS, cocoa manufacturers, William Cooper, representative, 425 Kent Street. - Sands, 1888 (compiled 1887). I imagine he is the same William Cooper who lived at 'Woollahra House', Rose Bay (Point Piper). He returned to England in 1888 - collection.hht.net.au/firsthhtpictures/picturerecord.jsp?... RECKITT AND SONS LTD, black lead manufacturers, 425 Kent Street. - Sands, 1888 I'm a little concerned at the idea of chocolate and lead manufacturers operating in the same building!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Deserves a box of [Cadbury's] chocolates for finding all that out.

I am still wondering about this c.1890 collection of odd Kent Street buildings.  Was it something to do with the building of the Kent Street branch sewer?  I cannot find anything in Trove about it. Hmmm ...

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47201412@N02] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32162360@N00] 423 Kent Street used be the home of Smith & Miles* typesetters, who for some 80 years were one of Sydney's leading typesmiths. I remember visiting their premises often (it was the othe half of 425, pictured) during my year as a despatch boy for Hansen-Rubensohn -- McCann-Erickson Advertising in 1963. Upstairs was "Stereo Services" - sadly both companies have gone - victims of phototype, lithographic printing, and now the internet. The proximity to a lead company, perhaps, was not a coincidence! Lead was used in the production of moveable type and printers stereos (which were duplicate printing plates). * See the following website: webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:b2PuBqDIJPQ... I agree with Beachcomber as to the location - just to the south of Market Street. Ironically I later worked at 383 Kent Street - this building though has long since gone.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] What an interesting past you have!

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] Thanks John, your memory really makes the building come to life, and reminds us it is more than just a picture.

comment.author: 89281666@N06
comment._content:
I did my apprentiship as a graphic reproducer at Smith and Miles starting in the late 1980's,a couple of years later it changed its name to The Image Centre ,in about 1995 it was brought out by David Graphics and moved into there premises in Surry hills.
Basically it was a dying trade with the advent of digital technology and the trade of prepress was no longer needed . I think Smith and Miles was located at 433 Kent st when I worked there,I recently was in the city and went down Kent st for a look the old building facade is still there with an apartment block towering out of it , there was a plaque on the wall about smith and miles it was well done I  thought .
